The Chicago Bulls dynasty was a sports dynasty of the Chicago Bulls in the National Basketball Association (NBA) that lasted from 1990 to 1998. The dynasty is characterized by player Michael Jordan and coach Phil Jackson, who both led the Chicago Bulls during the dynasty.
Phil Jackson
Before joining the Bulls, Jackson was a player and coach, playing for the New York Knicks and New York Nets from 1967 to 1980 and coaching the Albany Patroons. Jackson joined the Bulls as an assistant coach in 1987 under head coach Doug Collins. When Collins was fired in 1989, Jackson became head coach of the Bulls...
